resources.string: Both root access and Shizuku are unavailable.
You need to either provide root access or the permission to use Shizuku.
Welcome to WADBS, a small companion app that makes your life as a developer much easier! Before you start, please, grant some necessary permissions.
WADBS will display a notification when it encounters an error which is usually because it lacks a needed set of privileges.

Root access allows WADBS to change the state of Wireless Debugging, gather connection data and interact with KDE Connect to instantly pair your Android device with your PC via local network.\nThis permission is optional if you use Shizuku.
Alternatively to root access WADBS can utilize Shizuku to gain the needed set of privileges. Note that KDE Connect integration does not work with Shizuku.
Grant all of the required permissions and then tap \"Continue\".

Magisk displays a toast whenever some app is granted root access. WADBS frequently checks the state of Wireless Debugging on your device to update its widgets (you can edit the interval in settings). This makes Magisk\'s notifications somewhat annoying.\n\nYou can disable Magisk\'s root access notifications from the \"Superuser\" tab (tap on WADBS in the list there to see more options for it).
Tweak more specific settings in the app.
Shortcuts are not available while Wireless Debugging is disabled.
Wireless Debugging is unavailable while Wi-Fi is disabled.
WADBS requires some additional configuration. Please, finish setting it up before managing widgets.
Sends a notification when WADBS is missing sufficient privileges (root access or Shizuku)
Expand this notification to learn more.
WADBS requires either root access or the permission to use Shizuku. Currently it seems like it has none of those. Ensure the minimum level of privileges and restart the app.
Enable wireless debugging right after system has booted up

When your phone boots, you are not connected to a Wi-Fi network immediately. WADBS will wait for a connection, enable wireless debugging and perform the sync (if enabled). If after the specified time your device has still not connected to any network, WADBS will stop the monitoring process. You can always enable wireless debugging manually.
Amount of time WADBS should wait for a Wi-Fi connection after the boot is completed
Put connection data into the clipboard after enabling wireless debugging
KDE Connect integration requires root privileges
If this option is enabled your clipboard will be synced with KDE Connect when you enable wireless debugging using a widget. KDE Connect must be installed for this to work.
If this option is enabled, connection data will be prefixed with a string defined below. This allows user scripts to separate it from other clipboard data and automatically connect with your device.
Define prefix for your custom scripts.
Specify how transparent this widget should be.
Specify the corner roundness for widget\'s background.\nCorner radius is calculated relative to your system\'s default corner radius for widget background.
Choose whether to use surface or container color for widget background.\nTransparency is applied independently.
Whether to use light-colored text.\nThis option may improve readability when using semi-transparent background on dark wallpaper.
Visit this project\'s page on GitHub
Report a bug or suggest a feature
This widget provides a switch to enable Android\'s Wireless Debugging feature.
Displays current Wireless Debugging connection information and allows to copy it.
Refer to the app for instructions
